trans-unit.source: Getting Started with Azure storage and Visual Studio connected services (WebJob projects)
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with Azure storage and Visual Studio connected services (WebJob projects)

trans-unit.source: How to get started using Azure table storage in an Azure WebJobs 5 project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: How to get started using Azure table storage in an Azure WebJobs 5 project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: This article provides C# code samples that show show how to use the Azure WebJobs SDK version 1.x with the Azure table storage service.
trans-unit.target: This article provides C# code samples that show show how to use the Azure WebJobs SDK version 1.x with the Azure table storage service.

trans-unit.source: The code samples use the <linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title> version 1.x.
trans-unit.target: The code samples use the <linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title> version 1.x.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Table storage service enables you to store large amounts of structured data.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Table storage service enables you to store large amounts of structured data.

trans-unit.source: The service is a NoSQL datastore that accepts authenticated calls from inside and outside the Azure cloud.
trans-unit.target: The service is a NoSQL datastore that accepts authenticated calls from inside and outside the Azure cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure tables are ideal for storing structured, non-relational data.
trans-unit.target: Azure tables are ideal for storing structured, non-relational data.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>How to use Table Storage from .NET</linkText><title>How to use Table Storage from .NET</title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>How to use Table Storage from .NET</linkText><title>How to use Table Storage from .NET</title> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Some of the code snippets show the Table attribute used in functions that are called manually, that is, not by using one of the trigger attributes.
trans-unit.target: Some of the code snippets show the Table attribute used in functions that are called manually, that is, not by using one of the trigger attributes.

trans-unit.source: To add entities to a table, use the Table attribute with an ICollector or IAsyncCollector parameter where T specifies the schema of the entities you want to add. The attribute constructor takes a string parameter that specifies the name of the table.
trans-unit.target: To add entities to a table, use the Table attribute with an ICollector or IAsyncCollector parameter where T specifies the schema of the entities you want to add. The attribute constructor takes a string parameter that specifies the name of the table.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample adds Person entities to a table named Ingress.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample adds Person entities to a table named Ingress.

trans-unit.source: Typically the type you use with ICollector derives from TableEntity or implements ITableEntity, but it doesn't have to.
trans-unit.target: Typically the type you use with ICollector derives from TableEntity or implements ITableEntity, but it doesn't have to.

trans-unit.source: Either of the following Person classes work with the code shown in the preceding Ingress method.
trans-unit.target: Either of the following Person classes work with the code shown in the preceding Ingress method.

trans-unit.source: If you want to work directly with the Azure storage API, you can add a CloudStorageAccount parameter to the method signature.
trans-unit.target: If you want to work directly with the Azure storage API, you can add a CloudStorageAccount parameter to the method signature.

trans-unit.source: Because data ingress functions often process large volumes of data, the WebJobs SDK dashboard provides real-time monitoring data.
trans-unit.target: Because data ingress functions often process large volumes of data, the WebJobs SDK dashboard provides real-time monitoring data.

trans-unit.source: The Invocation Log section tells you if the function is still running.
trans-unit.target: The Invocation Log section tells you if the function is still running.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Ingress function running</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Ingress function running</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Invocation Details page reports the function's progress (number of entities written) while it's running and gives you an opportunity to abort it.
trans-unit.target: The Invocation Details page reports the function's progress (number of entities written) while it's running and gives you an opportunity to abort it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Ingress function running</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Ingress function running</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the function finishes, the Invocation Details page reports the number of rows written.
trans-unit.target: When the function finishes, the Invocation Details page reports the number of rows written.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Ingress function finished</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Ingress function finished</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To read a table, use the Table attribute with an IQueryable parameter where type T derives from TableEntity or implements ITableEntity.
trans-unit.target: To read a table, use the Table attribute with an IQueryable parameter where type T derives from TableEntity or implements ITableEntity.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample reads and logs all rows from the Ingress table:
trans-unit.target: The following code sample reads and logs all rows from the Ingress table:

trans-unit.source: There is a Table attribute constructor with two additional parameters that let you specify the partition key and row key when you want to bind to a single table entity.
trans-unit.target: There is a Table attribute constructor with two additional parameters that let you specify the partition key and row key when you want to bind to a single table entity.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample reads a table row for a Person entity based on partition key and row key values received in a queue message:
trans-unit.target: The following code sample reads a table row for a Person entity based on partition key and row key values received in a queue message:

trans-unit.source: The Person class in this example does not have to implement ITableEntity.
trans-unit.target: The Person class in this example does not have to implement ITableEntity.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Table attribute with a CloudTable object for more flexibility in working with a table.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Table attribute with a CloudTable object for more flexibility in working with a table.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample uses a CloudTable object to add a single entity to the Ingress table.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample uses a CloudTable object to add a single entity to the Ingress table.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to use the CloudTable object, see How to use Table Storage from .NET.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to use the CloudTable object, see How to use Table Storage from .NET.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to handle table processing triggered by a queue message, or for WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to table processing, see <linkText>How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to handle table processing triggered by a queue message, or for WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to table processing, see <linkText>How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article has provided code samples that show how to handle common scenarios for working with Azure tables.
trans-unit.target: This article has provided code samples that show how to handle common scenarios for working with Azure tables.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to use Azure WebJobs and the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to use Azure WebJobs and the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
